direction.raw_text: by Todd Solondz Final draft
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Fiction
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The time is circa 1985. Vi and Marcus finish making love. Marcus has cerebral palsy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you want to hear my short story now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can read it to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean, again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I changed the ending a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. What happens now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, actually, it's the same, but longer. I think it's better. More...raw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then, maybe you should just read the ending.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it won't make any sense if you hear it out of context.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you should leave it the way it was. It was good. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you don't want to hear my new ending?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll read it in class tomorrow. Surprise me. (beat) Anyway, I have to go. I promised Melinda I'd help her with her oral. She rises, starts dressing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're tired of me. I can tell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcus, I'm tired. That's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've lost interest...You hardly even sweat any more when we have sex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was never much of a sweater. You know that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Vi, I don't blame you. You feel You feel pity now. The pleasure isn't there any more. The kinkiness has gone...You've become kind. EXT. CAMPUS GREEN - DAY It is bright and sunny.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (lifts a MS from a shelf by his bed)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mr Scott, who is black, presides over his class. Marcus is reading from his story, Vi at his side. Catherine, a stunning intellectual, sits near the teacher. The rest of the students (Amy, Elli, etc.) listen closely and take notes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...but when he saw her...it was as if he could walk like a normal person. His legs didn't swing, his arms didn't spaz away...He wasn't a freak any more, for she made him forget his affliction. No more cerebral palsy! From now on  "CP" stood for...cerebral person. He was a cerebral person. Pause. Marcus and Vi exchange looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought it was really good, Marcus...Really moving and emotional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I thought it was really emotional, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I mean, really good word choices. It kind of reminded me a little of Faulkner, but East Coast and disabled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or Flannery O'Connor. She had multiple sclerosis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Borges. He was blind. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Updike has psoriasis. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um...Maybe I'm wrong, but, um, I'm afraid I found the whole thing to be a little trite. Its earnestness is, well...it's a little embarrassing. And those adjectives, they're a little flatfooted. And redundant. I'm sorry, but...Anyway, what do I know? Don't even listen to what I say. I mean... Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyone else? No response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Catherine is right. The story's a piece of shit. You express nothing but banalities and, formally speaking, are unable to construct a single compelling sentence. You ride on a wave of cliches so worn, in fact, it actually approaches a level of grotesquerie. Ad your subtitle, 'the rawness of truth' is that supposed to be a joke of some sort? Or are you just being pretentious? (beat; then checking his class book) OK. Who's next?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcus, upset, rushes outside, Vi in pursuit, desperately trying to console.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcus, wait up! Marcus stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be so upset. It's OK...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck are you talking about? What's OK?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know he hated my story also.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your story was terrible! He moves on, she keeps up with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcus...You'll write something better next time!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Patronizing fuck! If you had just been honest with me in the first place I wouldn't have read it. I knew it was shit. But - idiot! - I believed you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not fair! I was honest! Just because I wasn't sucking up like         that bitch Catherine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I sure didn't hear you voice your opinion in there when it mattered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I admit it - I was scared! I was shocked, in fact , by what he said. And he's so...convincing. I'm sorry if I let you down, but really, I still say he's just one opinion. I don't even like his books that much. They're all so aggressively confrontational. I don't care if he's won the Pulitzer Prize. Catherine and Mr Scott walk by together in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just want to fuck him. Like Catherine and every other white cunt on campus. He leaves her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melinda lies on her bed with some homework, watching Vi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...But Marcus! You can't just unilaterally decide to end things. This is a relationship we're talking about! A friendship! You don't just...Fuck you! She hangs up and enters her bedroom, in tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck him! Fuck him! Fuck him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vi? Are you OK?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I'm OK. I'm totally OK. Melinda rises, puts a hand on her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did the right thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that. Fucking cripple. Why do I waste my time with undergrads? They're all so...juvenile! Uch! I just thought Marcus would be different. I mean he's got CP! Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you gonna do now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno...go to a bar...get laid...whatever...Don't worry about me. I'll be fine... She starts changing into a new outfit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Students hang around outside. Vi goes inside. INT. BAR - NIGHT Vi walks up to the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I have a beer? After getting her beer, Vi turns around and suddenly notices Mr Scott, who is sitting alone. She goes over to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Vi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I didn't mean, I just didn't expect to run into you here, that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, now you have. Vi laughs, sort of, ten blushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, um, then...are you alone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I join you? Mr Scott gestures for her to sit down with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee, thanks. Well, um...I just wanted to say that I'm really happy with the class and, um...I know you must here this all the time, but I'm also a great admirer of your work. A Sunday Lynching, especially...really, um spoke to me. God, I hope I'm not embarrassing you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. (beat) 'Cause I...um...I really agreed with everything you had to say last week about how bad my story was...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I also agreed with what you said today about Marcus's story. It is a piece of shit. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have beautiful skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. (beat) So Catherine seems like she might become a really good writer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe. She's OK. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't you going out with Catherine? (beat) I'm sorry. It's none of my business. I didn't mean...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not 'going out' with Catherine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. (beat) Do you think I have a potential as a writer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you for being honest. Mr Scott leans over and touches her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have so much respect for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr Scott and Vi walk together in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vi and Mr Scott enter. He turns around and looks at her. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I just freshen up for a second? He indicates the direction of the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's over there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vi enters, locks the door behind her. She looks at herself in the mirror, then notices a snapshot of Catherine: she is naked, legs open wide. Other erotic photographs lie beneath Catherine's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be a racist. Don't be a racist. Don't be a racist...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vi emerges from the bathroom to find Mr Scott lounging on the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a really nice place you have. Is the rent high?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take off your top. She obliges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now...take off the rest. She does, and he looks hard at her. Finally he rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn around. She does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bend over. He starts making love to her, from behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, 'nigger, fuck me.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, bu...uh...I can't say that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, Ni...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ni...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...gger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...gger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, 'Nigger.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Fuck me hard!'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck me hard!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, 'Nigger, fuck me hard!'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nigger, fuck me hard!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nigger, fuck me hard!!...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lights are out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcus looks in the mirror, ponders his reflection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freak. There is a soft knock at the door. He turns  away from the mirror and opens it. Vi is there, teary-eyed, disheveled. VI Can I come in? They embrace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're all...sweaty!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vi finishes reading her story to the class.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...So John flipped her around and slammed her against the wall. Jane braced herself: she thought about her mother. She thought about Peter. She thought about God...and rape. ''Say, 'Fuck me, nigger. Fuck me hard.''' John's flesh abraded her soft skin. There would be marks. She acquiesced, and said what he asked her to say, and did what he asked her to do. She had entered college with hope, with dignity, but she would graduate as a whore.' Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do people have to be so ugly...write about such ugly characters? It's perverted. I know you all think I'm being prisssy, but I don't care. I was brought up in a certain way. And this is...mean-spirited! Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, it did seem a little affected. Like by using taboo language you were trying to shock us about the hollowness of your characters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it was a little bit racist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was completely racist, and beyond that I felt deeply offended as a         woman. As if a woman can only operate from experiences of objectification.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Totally phallocentric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And so weirdly misogynistic. I mean, why does Jane go through with this? Is she stupid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, But wasn't this a rape? Or ...did I miss something? Because I - I'm confused. Because if this was a rape, then why would she be a whore?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was confessional, yet dishonest. Jane pretends to be horrified by         the sexuality that she in fact fetishizes. She subsumes herself to the myth of black male potency, but then doesn't follow through. She thinks she 'respects Afro-Americans,' she thinks they're 'cool,' 'exotic,' what a notch he 'd make in her belt, but, of course, it all comes down to mandingo cliche, and he calls her on it. In classic racist tradition she demonizes, then runs for cover. But then, how could she behave otherwise? She's just a spoiled suburban white girl with a Benneton rainbow complex. It's just my opinion, and what do I know...but I think it's a callow piece of writing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Callow and coy. Jane wants more, but isn't honest enough to admit it. In the end, she returns to the safety of her crippled (translation: sexually impotent) boyfriend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is bullshit! Her story was the truth!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's unbelievable!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's cliched!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's disgusting!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it happened! Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know about 'what happened,' Vi, because once you start writing, it  all becomes fiction. Still, it certainly is an improvement over your last story: There is now at least a beginning, a middle, and an end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 'NONFICTION' INT. TOBY'S BEDROOM - NIGHT A Lower East Side tenement apartment. A dogma '95 poster hangs above the bed. Toby, down and out and in his thirties, leafs through his high-school yearbook. He reads an inscription: 'Toby, I just know you're going to become a movie star! Please don't forget me when you make it to the top! I will always love you - Pam'. He picks up his phone and dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, is this Pam?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toby Oxman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toby -? Oh, hi! How are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, fine. How are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I was gonna ask you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But...you called.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah, well...um...I was just calling because, well, I was wondering if you still remembered me, which I guess you do...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So. Look at where we are: the year 2000! Can you believe it? I mean, did you ever think we would actually make it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, well, yeah. (beat) So are you still acting?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no, not any more. No, um, I kind of came to terms with myself, I realized I had done what I had to do. And it was time to move on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. So what did you do after you gave up on acting?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I went to law school, if you can believe that. Mike, Toby's roommate and cameraman, enters looking for a towel, then goes to take a shower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, it was really all kind of a joke - and a rip-off, so, uh...so I dropped out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that's too bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, then it got me writing, so that was a good thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything I might know about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, um, I kind of let things go on this novel I'd been really into - I mean, the whole publishing industry is totally corrupt. I mean, really, it's finished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's too bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I worked over at a homeless shelter for a while, drove a cab to pay the rent, but, I mean, that was like - I mean, I have some dignity. PAM (V.O.) That's good. So then what do you do now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a documentary filmmaker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh? Anything I might have seen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: N-not yet. I'm hoping to get a grant for this one project on teenagers. Geez, remember when we were teenagers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. You didn't wanna take me to the prom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I don't remember that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, but it was so long ago. We were so different back then... No response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, well, anyway, so I'm looking for subjects for this documentary on teenage life in suburbia. Kind of an exploration of the mental psyche of its mythology. I wrote to Derrida to see if he'd like to do the narration. But everything's still kind of in development at this point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hunh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I work in a shoe store right now. But it's cool. I'm not ashamed. I mean, really, I have a much stronger sense of self now. And, uh, anyways, it's really very temporary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...um...so anyway, tell me. What about you? I'd heard through the grapevine you were producing movies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. But not any more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Tired of 'life in the fast lane'? No response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...So you're um...you're married?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh. Kids?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great. How old are they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight, six, and four.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow, that really is great. In a few years, who knows, maybe they'll want to be in my documentary! Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, Toby, I can't really talk right now. Do you mind if I call you back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe she has caller ID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is bright and shiny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have any hobbies?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DEMARCO'S OFFICE - DAY Scooby, seventeen, and Mr DeMarco, the guidance counselor, sit opposite each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any books you like to read for fun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None at all? How about those 'underground' comics?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate reading.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, Scooby, let's not beat around the bush. With your attitude, you're not going to get in anywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'OK.' So you just don't care. (beat) Let me ask you, not as your guidance counselor, but...as a friend: what do you want to do with your life? I mean, what kind of long-term goals can you possibly have?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon. Talk to me. Tell me what you're thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I mean...I wanna be on TV. Maybe have a talk show or something. Like Conan. Or early Letterman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah-hah. And how is it you hope to achieve this goal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno. See if I have any connections.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGSTON HOME  EVENING The sprinkler system is still on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DINING ROOM  EVENING The family is sitting waiting at the table: FERN, Scooby's attractive mother; MARTY, his bullish father; BRADY, sixteen, his handsome jock brother; and MIKEY, ten his smart youngest brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the maid, brings some bread to the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you knock on his door?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, but he just shouted at me and used the f-word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scooby! Dinner! No response. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would anyone be interested in being hypnotized after dinner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's just start. They eat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what's wrong with that kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he's gay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't ever say that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if he is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He isn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marty, ignore him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's vegetarian, doesn't do sports...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brady! Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And even if he is... Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gay people are people too, you know. You're just being prejudiced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care is he's gay. I'm cool. I mean, it's not like I have to share his room or anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just want to know what the hell he's doing in his room that's so interesting he doesn't come down for dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he's building a bomb...just like-!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't even joke about that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm serious! What happens if he blows up the school? A tense pause, followed by a distant crushing sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going in there. Scooby appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was anyone in my room today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is everything OK?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My CD case like totally collapsed. I'm gonna have to recatalogue all weekend. (sitting down) Hey. Can you pass the salad over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steak's really good tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got a lot of homework?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whaddya mean you don't know? You either got a lot or you don't. What's not to know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marty...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You started filling out your college applications yet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to college. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you going to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What DO you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad, I'm trying to figure things out right now, OK? It's like, really hard, and I'm just listening to some old Elton John and... Brady mouths: 'Gay!'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out! Leave the table!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard me: leave the table!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, I am out of here! This family is so fucked! Brady leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, it's not fair if Brady can say the f-word and I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, Mikey, listen up. Cause here's a lesson: life's not fair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINSTON HOME - DAY A red sports car drives up front. Esposito, Brady's buddy, drops off Brady and Cheryl, Brady's cheerleader girlfriend. A cleaning woman walks along the sidewalk on her way to the bus stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll talk to you later, man!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo, dude!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Esposito!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TV ROOM  DAY Brady, still in his football outfit, tracks in some dirt. Cheryl follows him to his room, giggling. Mikey sits on the sofa while Consuelo continues her housework.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consuelo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Mikey?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have any brothers or sisters?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? How many?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four brothers and five sisters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. (beat) Why did your parents have so many children? I mean, if they were poor, wouldn't it be better to have just one or two?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was God's will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But do you really believe in God? And heaven, hell and angels and all kind of stuff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DINING ROOM  EVENING The Livingstons are eating dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So? How was school today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same. Same as what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just the same. A tense pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're studying the Holocaust in Social Studies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We did the same thing last year also.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How was the class?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm supposed to watch Schindler's List for homework. The movie's like almost four hours. And then I'm supposed to write a report on survivors. (to Marty) You know any survivors, Dad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmmm...Do I know any...personally...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, technically your Zeda is a survivor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was in a concentration camp?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, no. But he had to escape the Nazis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I thought he came over to America before the war.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he did. With his family. But his cousins, they had to stay and they were all killed. And if he'd stayed, he would have been killed. So in my book he's a survivor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even though it was only his cousins that were killed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that could've happened to him. Or to me, if I'd been alive. Or you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean, then, we're all survivors?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...yes. If it hadn't been for Hitler, he wouldn't have had to leave Europe. We would have been...European.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But then, in a sense, since you would never have met Dad if your family had stayed in Europe...if it weren't for Hitler, none of us would have been born. A long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the hell outta here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, it's just, like, conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toby sits across from Mr Kirk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me: you make a living at this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, sir...uh...I'm actually not doing this for the money. When you make a documentary, you do it for many reasons, but money is certainly not one of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't get it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, sir, a lot has happened to the landscape of the suburban high school since I was a student, and I feel it would be a valuable, perhaps even enlightening endeavor, to chronicle the changes, to get intimate with the realities kids and parents face in American schools today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, whatever. I'll let you know if there's interest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toby pauses by the receptionist before leaving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, where's the bathroom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAVATORY  DAY Toby rushes to the urinal. Scooby is sitting in a corner, smoking a joint, observing him. Toby smells the pot, turns and smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You a pervert?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...Actually, I'm a documentary filmmaker?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. You mean, like, Blair Witch Project?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, no. I'm doing one on high school students, in fact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...it's kind of a sociological study in the aftermath of Columbine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this to like get into Sundance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, it's possible they would be interested in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doubt it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, there is some interest from the Sundance Channel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoopee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and MTV have also shown some interest. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you have connections...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGSTON HOME  NIGHT The lights are on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see, we're trying to do a film on suburban lifestyles...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGSTON HOME  NIGHT Toby sits in the living room surrounded by the Livingston family. Marty fingers a card that reads: TOBY OXMAN, DOCUMENTARIAN. His address and phone number are printed below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...kind of An American Family for the new millennium...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought this was about kids getting into college.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, it is. I mean MARTY Which is it? You gotta keep your focus straight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're absolutely right. The focus is on the college admissions process today. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you want Scooby to be the focus of all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scooby and a few other students of different socioeconomic backgrounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, well, I don't have them yet, but MARTY Either Scooby is the focus, or forget it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I thought I was the focus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna be the focus. Brady slaps him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toby, we need this to be a positive experience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I suppose I could reconceive...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reconceive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cause Scooby does have a quality that I've been looking for, a quality that is emblematic of American today. It's part disillusionment, part hope... Consuelo comes in with tea and Twinkies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twinkeys!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boys, take napkins...Napkins...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not to be crass, but what do we get out of this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, he doesn't mean money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I know, I know that. Well, sharing your story, your ups and downs, and so forth, can I hope, be an illuminating experience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...How do we know we won't be exploited?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr Livingston, I fully understand and I share your concerns. You fell vulnerable. And I know that this is a very difficult question, but what it comes down to is: can you make a leap of faith in me, in the same way that I have to make a leap of faith in you? ON VIDEO: INT. LOCKER ROOM  DAY Big Esposito, in football attire, surrounded by Brady and other athletes, talks to Toby. Kids whip towels at each other in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a great school. I don't care what anybody says. I mean, it's not perfect, but like the people are really cool, like the teachers and kids...they really care and all. And I know that they make fun of New Jersey all the time, but I don't care. 'Cause they're just snobs. 'Cause Jersey is where America's at!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. EMPTY SCHOOL HALLWAY  DAY TOBY (V.O.) Walking down these hallways just like the ones I once walked down as a teenager, I couldn't help thinking back to a time when every day I woke up depressed, suicidal, consumed by despair. Had things changed? Was the competition to get into the most prestigious schools still a requisite rite of passage? Beneath these masks of courtesy and friendliness I knew that there were darker forces at work...and I knew that Scooby was the key to revealing the truth...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S OF SCOOBY ...looking pensive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scooby, Scooby, Scooby...What are you thinking? College, SATs, your parents, your brothers, your friends...How is it you deal with all this stress?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. CLASSROOM  DAY A school psychologist sits at her desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pressure to get into the college of your choice is incredible. You know, they did a study recently of the youth in Bosnia during the bombing, and they found that the stress the young people experienced there was less than what American high- school students go through when applying to college.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EDITING ROOM  NIGHT Toby and his editor examine the footage on an AVID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So whaddya think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm not really sure what you're trying to say. It's funny, I suppose. But it seems glib and facile to just make fun of how idiotic these people are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not making fun. I'm showing it as it really is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're showing how superior you are to your subject.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, but I like my subject. I like these people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I do. I love them! Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The camerawork's nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. I'll tell Mike. (beat) Well, it's still just a beginning. I know I can...dig deeper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGSTON HOME  DAY It is bright and sunny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGSTON HOME  DAY Fern is in the kitchen talking on the phone. She has a list of names and notes in front of her. Consuelo dusts in the background. Toby and Mike stand nearby with a video camera, recording everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...but Marj  may I call you Marj? what it really boils down to is...what does it mean to be a Jew?...Exactly. Tzedakah. Charity. And the new wing at Beth Israel is...Well, actually, last year you gave $500. But this year $1,000 would not only be a mitzvah, it would bring you to a new level...Yes, of course. Your gift would also give you a Chagall menorah and two tickets to the dinner dance this spring...Because it's true: Israel needs us now. If not now, when?...Well, that's wonderful...I'll speak to you next week...You too! Take care! She hangs up just as Scooby walks inside, fresh from school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Scooby! How was school today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready for tomorrow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's tomorrow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SATs, knucklehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not taking them. He walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. DINNER ROOM  EVENING The family is eating dinner. There is a tense silence, finally broken by Mikey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Mikey?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was looking through Scooby's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: s practice books this afternoon and I took one of the practice tests. Guess what score I got?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: verbal, 520 math. And I'm only in fifth grade! Everyone turns to glare at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHILDREN'S BATHROOM  NIGHT Scooby is brushing his teeth when Marty enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scooby?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to talk. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whaddya wanna talk about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't screw around with me. You know what I'm talking about. (beat) You're taking those SATs. You're taking those SATs or your CD collection is history. You're taking those SATs and you're going to college. You're taking those
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: s if I have to strap your ass to a chair, but buddy your taking them. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tired of this shit...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (under his breath as he starts walking away)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Toby and Mike shoot footage of the students as they take their SATs. Scooby is filling out his SAT in such a way that he creates a pattern of filled blanks that spells: FUCK THIS SHIT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGSTON HOME  DAY Toby and Mike are interviewing Brady and Cheryl in the driveway. Off to the side, Mikey tries hypnotizing a cat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So are you surprised that Scooby took the SATs after all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not really. He's kind of a wuss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . How about you, Cheryl? Were you surprised?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno. Whatever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, how come you drive such a shitty car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know...That's interesting, though. A cool car. Is that something that's real important to you, Brady?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh duh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCOOBY'S BEDROOM  DAY Scooby handles a gun his friend Stanley has given him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty cool, Stanley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you get it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my Dad's He hides it under some old TV Guides in his closet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee, your Dad's smart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it loaded?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't think so... Scooby points it at his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scooby, don't! Be careful!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not an idiot, man. I watch TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know. I'm sorry. I'm just...a little nervous, I don't know why.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should be. Scooby points it at Stanley, gets a terrified reaction, then tosses the gun aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. You can keep it. He lies down. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scooby?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know...I like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Everyone knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. (beat) Do you think that you'd let me...um... Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . If you feel like it. Just give me a second. He pulls a bag of mushrooms out from beneath his night table, takes some and offers to Stanley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want some?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thanks. Scooby flicks on a CD, then lies down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGSTON HOME  DAY While Stanley goes down on Scooby, the camera pans away from Scooby to reveal Marty and Fern being burned at the stake in the front yarn, writhing and screaming in agony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so sorry! I should never have made you take the SATs! The camera then pans to reveal Conan O'Brien approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Scooby! How's it going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conan O'Brien? Whoa! What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking for a last-minute guest for my show. Any suggestions?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be your guest!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? Well, all right! Let's take a look at the television and see how we look. The camera pans to reveal a TV standing on the lawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cool! Conan turns on the TV and we move inside it to see Conan and Scooby sharing some talk-show patter and repartee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome to the show, Scooby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to have you here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great to be here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And thank you for dressing up for us. This is very classy. Tell us. What kind of professional plans do you have? What's in your future?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I was thinking...I might work for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahh...tell me. What do you want to do for me? What's your idea?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be your sidekick, you know, and maybe eventually become a TV talk- show host.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: talk-show host, OK. You were at sidekick eight seconds ago, then
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: talk-show host. You'll be a Latin dictator in a bout a minute. Audience laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see what they think of the first idea. I'm curious what the audience thinks. Folks, what do you think: should Scooby be my new sidekick? Audience cheers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scooby, new sidekick, everybody! Bigger round of applause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. CHILDREN'S BATHROOM  NIGHT Scooby has spaced out while flossing. There is a knock at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? Brady enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. What's up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something I need to talk about with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are some rumors...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know...Stanley...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And like, don't take this the wrong way...I mean, I'm cool...but...you know...I've got a good reputation at school and, well...I really don't want it ruined. He is visibly upset. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No prob. I'm cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Scoob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HIGH-SCHOOL PLAYING FIELD  DAY A football scrimmage is in progress. A play ends, and the Coach comes on to the field, barking:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Esposito, What the fuck do you think you're doing? You're tackling like a bitch on my football team, son! You gotta bend your ass over and hit somebody! You understand me? ESPOSITO Yes, sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You understand me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then do it!...Livingston! That's the way to hit that hole, son! Brady waves a Cheryl in the stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're gonna become a football team today, guys! Let's move the ball! Move! Move! Move! I wanna see you hit those holes! Defense, fill those goddam gaps! Let's go, guys! Let's do it!... On the next play Brady runs to catch a pass, but is moved down by Esposito shouting, 'KILL HIM!!!' Cheryl jumps up, alarmed. O.S. cheerleaders finish their 'Go Bucks!' cheer, but Brady doesn't rise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOSPITAL ICU  EVENING Brady lies unconscious in bed, hooked up to machines. Marty, Fern, Scooby, and Cheryl stand around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGSTON HOME  NIGHT Mikey sits at the kitchen table with Consuelo. He is eating ice cream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I'm in high school I'm not going to play any football. I'm just going to concentrate on class rank. (beat) What did you do in high school?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did not go to high school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weren't there high schools in El Salvador?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We had to work. My family was poor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must've been hard being poor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm still poor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmmm. (beat) But, Consuelo, even though your poor, don't you have any hobbies or interests or anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Mikey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But like, what do you like to do when you're not working?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm always working.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But when you're not. Like now. What do you like to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's not like real work. This is just babysitting. Consuelo stares hard at him in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, your job's really not so bad, if you think about it. You should smile more often.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : DOCUMENTARY FOOTAGE OF: (1) Driving-along-the-neighborhood shots; a lam post; a sign; a floating straw wrapper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When the sky is clear and the sun is warm, you're reminded of how beautiful things can be: a lamp post, a sign, a straw wrapper blowing in the wind...But when that dark cloud appears, you realize how fragile the balance of life is. (2) The neurologist Dr Barry Jordan discussing Brady's condition:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When Brady first arrived at the hospital he was unresponsive to verbal stimuli. Wee performed a CT scan which demonstrated a large subdural hemotoma with mass effect. Since the removal of the subdural he's been in coma. (3) A psychologist discussing the effect of the Brady crisis on his family:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I first met the Livingstons it was in the first twenty four hours of Brady coming in after his tragic football accident and they were acting in a fairly typical way... (4) The Livingstons consulting with Dr Goodman in a hospital waiting room:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not the ones who need the help. My son needs help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My son's in there! He can't even feed himself, he can't eat  I don't even know if he's going to be a vegetable or not, for Chrissake! The picture freezes and then zooms into a close up on Scooby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what about Scooby? How would this effect him? What meaning is to be found in this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EDITING ROOM  DAY Toby and his editor finish watching this latest footage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is definitely better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think so? You don't think that this might not be a little dry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is entertainment you're making, Toby. This story about a kid in the suburbs and the state of the college admissions process has, with this Brady crisis, evolved into something much richer and more provocative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I know...But still, it should be somewhat entertaining. EDITOR I mean, without this footage, without this rigorous documentation, it would feel like exploitation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, no. No exploitation. This is serious...But don't you find it a little funny too, at the same time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got a family tragedy on your hands. Will you tell me what's funny about that? About a kid in a coma?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing, I guess...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, why are you making this documentary if you can't treat your subject with appropriate gravity? TOBY OK, you're right, you're right... (beat) You know, we need to screen what we've got...invite some regular people, just some random off-the- street types...and see what real people think of this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno, Toby. We really have a long way to go. You still need a lot more footage, and it's probably a little premature to start screening...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: then we can invite serious intellectual types.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hip alternative types who will understand the process better...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not ready!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I need to see this with an audience!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's an audience going to tell you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Maybe they'll like it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGSTON HOME  NIGHT Mikey opens the refrigerator, takes out a bottle of grape juice, pours a cup for himself, then accidentally spills it all on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consuelo! I spilled some grape juice on the floor!...Consuelo?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BASEMENT RECREATION ROOM  NIGHT Mikey goes downstairs, finds her alone in her bedroom. She appears to be upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consuelo? No response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consuelo. Are you crying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, you are. I can tell. What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mi Jesus...mi jesus...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speak English.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mi Jesus esta muerto!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consuelo, I'm sorry, but you know if you don't speak English I can't understand you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Jesus...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is Jesus?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a bay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My grandchild-baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee, I didn't even know you had any children. But why are you so upset about Jesus?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. How did it happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was executed. He was on Death Row and then he was executed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did they execute him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poison gas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it's for the best...I mean, if he was guilty of doing  something wrong...People who are bad should be killed. Don't you think so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus was not bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he was and you just didn't know it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wasn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But still, you can't be sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But really, you never know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why was he on Death Row?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For rape and murder. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consuelo, what is rape exactly?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is when you love someone, and they don't love you. And then you do something about it. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes I feel like my parents don't love me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then, when you get older you can do something about it. A long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consuelo? I spilled some grape juice upstairs. Do you think you could clean up the floor now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRADY'S BEDROOM  EVENING Marty and Mikey sit by the comatose Brady, who lies now in his own bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad?...Do you think that Brady will ever get better?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One in a million recover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he's that one in a million!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mikey, there's optimism, and then there's stupidity. It's a very fine line. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think there's any hope, either. I was just trying to make you feel better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're welcome. (beat) Dad?...Would you let me try hypnotizing you now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Sure Go ahead. Hypnotize me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Stay there. I'll be right back. Mikey hurries off to fetch his hypnotizing apparatus. Marty sits and waits. MIKEY Just a sec!...Be right there! Mikey returns, sets himself up across from Marty and takes out a shiny object.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad, can you turn around a bit, please? Marty obliges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. All right. Now you must look at this shiny object and concentrate. Relax your legs. Relax your arms. Relax your shoulders. Now keep your eyes on the shiny object...Your eyelids are getting heavy...heavier...You're getting sleepy...sleepier...Now let your eyes close shut...and you are asleep. Marty's head drops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you are completely under my power. I am the only voice you can hear, the only voice you will listen to. Now. When you wake up you will be in a good mood. You won't worry so much about Brady. And I will be your favorite from now on. If Brady dies, you can be sad for a little bit, but I will still be the most important person in your life. You will never be mean to me, and always give me whatever I want. Also, you should fire Consuelo. She's lazy. Now when I snap my fingers, you will remember nothing, but you will do everything I have asked. One. Two. Three. Mikey snaps his fingers and Marty wakes up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Mikey. You wanna get some ice cream?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGSTON HOME  DAY A couple of maids are walking by with white babies in strollers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. SCOOBY'S BEDROOM  DAY SCOOBY So like, yeah...I caved in. I mean, I had to. My parents, they're like ...still really depressed about Brady. So I wrote the bullshit essay. Filled out the applications, did the interviews...Y'know, I figure I can always drop out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So where'd you get in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prnceton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what did you get on your SATs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: verbal/710 math. Kinda weird, I know. But I think they thought it was, like, good-weird.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. LIVING ROOM  EVENING Marty and Fern sit on the sofa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We used pull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, you have to. Sometimes you just have to, Toby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what kind of pull did you have?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a cousin. Very big giver to the alumni fund.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all about who you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, we're not suckers. Everyone else is out there doing the same thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGSTON HOME  DAY Scooby watches Toby and Mike as they try fixing their jammed camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn, Toby...This thing won't open again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me try it, let me try it. (takes camera from Mike) It's um...The button is just stuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, um, Toby? I was wondering...Is the documentary almost finished?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, yeah, we're getting there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I see what you have so far?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure...um...yeah, as soon as I have a screening I'll let you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGSTON HOME  DAY Mikey and Consuelo are playing cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gin! I win! Let's play again! He starts dealing another round when Marty suddenly appears, back from work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Mikey!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Dad!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come here, give me a hug!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee, you're home early!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, uh, listen. Why don't you go upstairs and keep your Mom and Brady company for a bit? I need to speak alone with Consuelo for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, Dad. He runs up the stairs, pretends to disappear, but stays to observe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consuelo. Mrs. Livingston and I have discussed this, and we've come to the conclusion that we are not very happy with your work lately, so we're going to let you go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've been happy with you in the past, but now we think maybe it's time for a change...uh...I know you've had trouble at home and maybe, you know, some of that is reflected I your work...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, Mr Livingston, I work very hard for you and your family!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand, I understand that, and I'm sorry it had to end this way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGSTON HOME  DAY Consuelo exits the house and trudges towards the bus stop, carrying all her belongings. Other cleaning women are waiting for the bus as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCOOBY'S BEDROOM  DAY Scooby is looking at the address on Toby's 'documentarian' calling card. He picks up the phone and dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SHOE STORE  DAY Dave, the store manager, leaves a costumer for a moment to pick up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Florsheim. Can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. I...uh...I'm trying to reach Toby Oxman?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, he's off today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...um...Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HIGHWAY  DAY Scooby drives his Mom's shiny new SUV to New York.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A RUN-DOWN TENEMENT NEIGHBORHOOD  DAY Scooby pulls into a spot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOBY'S APARTMENT BUILDING  DAY Scooby climbs a stairwell, rings a bell. Mike opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, uh, Mike. Is Toby here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, no, he's not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Do you have any idea where he might be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think he's at a test screening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOBY'S APARTMENT BUILDING  DAY Scooby hurries outside only to find his car stolen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUBWAY  DAY Scooby rides a train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCREENING-ROOM FACILITY  DAY Scooby sees a sign that reads: 'American Scooby: test screening.' He goes into the screening room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...of the documentary being screened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. LIVINGSTON HOME BACKYARD  DAY Marty talks to Toby poolside as he prepares a barbecue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think Scooby's like a lot of kids. He just hit a...a speed bump. Now he's gonna find his way, his path is gonna be cleared, and I think he's gonna continue his education at a good college. And everybody else is gonna be happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...But Mr Livingston, aren't you a bit fearful that Scooby will be confronted with hollow values and systemic conformism? Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know why this is so hard for you to comprehend. I had a terrific time in college. I've got a terrific job, a comfortable salary, terrific wife, three terrific kids...and every year I give to the alumni fund. Now why are you trying to make college out to be a bad thing, a negative experience? You were unhappy? Well, to bad! Get over it! Stop trying to impose your misery on others by going around saying, 'Life is bad, life is horrible.' Life is tough on you? Well, boo hoo!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. LIVINGSTON HOME - DAY Scooby talks to Toby in the Backyard, Marty seen in the distant background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Well, yeah, my Dad is kind of a goofball. I just have to pretend to go along with his ideas. 'Cause he really doesn't get it: like I could be the next Oprah, for all he knows, but he's never even seen the show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...watching himself on screen
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : NEW ANGLE ON SCOOBY ...as he continues talking to Toby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is most important to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno. I'd like to be good at something. It doesn't have to be
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I mean, it could be movies...Anything. I'd be willing to direct. The audience laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I'd like to be, you know...famous. Not necessarily a superstar, just famous. Be recognized. Get fan Mail. Things...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : TIGHTER ON SCOOBY ...still talking to Toby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, Scooby, now I understand how you want to be a TV talk-show host and all, like Conan O'Brien, but did you know even he went to college?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He did?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. He went to Harward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...watching the film and listening to the audience. The laughter is out of control. He is devastated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGSTON HOME - NIGHT Marty and Fern are in bed watching the news. Mikey appears in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom? Dad? Can I sleep with you? I'm scared. They flick off the TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure!...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, honey. Come in bed with us. Come on. Mikey gets in bed with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Snug as a bug in a rug. Yeah, here you go, pal. All righty...You're monster-proofed! EXT. LIVINGSTONE HOME - NIGHT Consuelo approaches the house stealthily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...opening the back of the house; stuffing towels under bedroom doors; turning on the kitchen stove's gas; switching on the main gas valve in the boiler room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVINGSTON HOME - NIGHT Consuelo flees. A very long pause.
direction.name: direction
